content: dragonskin dice bag pattern by michaela jandacek this cute little bag uses less than one 20 gram mini skein of sock yarn 16 grams including the twisted cord so it s the perfect way to show off your favorite hand-dye the stitch pattern is great for variegated yarns and it knits up fast with zero purling originally designed for tabletop rpg dice the bag holds up to 10 standard sets it s also the perfect size for tiny gifts tarot or playing cards or any other little treasures yarn ​20 grams 80 yards of any fingering-weight yarn needles ​us4 3 5mm dpns or circular needles if you prefer magic loop notions ​one locking stitch marker tapestry needle scissors base co 4 stitches onto one dpn or for magic loop r1 k​ fb around 8 sts splitting between 4 dpns as you go being careful not to twist join to work in the round r2 ​ kfb around 16 sts use a locking stitch marker to mark the beginning of the round r3 ​ *k1 kfb* around 24 sts r4 ​ *k2 kfb* around 32 sts r5 *​ k3 kfb* around 40 sts r6 ​*k4 kfb* around 48 sts r7 ​*k5 kfb* around 56 sts r8 ​*k6 kfb* around 64 sts r9 ​ knit body slip_stitch pattern r1 ​knit r2 ​ *k2 yo k2 slip yo over previous two stitches* around r3 ​ knit r4 ​ *yo k2 slip yo over previous two stitches k2* around work slip_stitch pattern row 1-4 8 times work eyelet row once *k2 yo k2tog* around work row 2-4 of slip_stitch pattern once more bind off k1 *pass stitch back to lh needle k2tog* to last stitch break yarn and pull through last stitch weave in ends and block if desired drawstring make a twisted cord h​ ere s a tutorial​ and thread through eyelets you re done
